twcore.core.lvz
Class LvzObject

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.lvz.LvzObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class LvzObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

The LvzObject struct can be used to build update packet to modify an LVZ object, or parse data from an incoming update packet.

For in-depth help on any lvz property, see the documentation included with the LVZ toolkit 

Data Layout
  Field   Length  Description
      0        1      Update Flags
      1        2      Object ID & Object Type
      3        2      Location [& Type] (x coord)
      5        2      Location [& Type] (y coord)
      7        1      LVZ Image ID
      8        1      LVZ Layer
      9        2      Display Time & Mode

Author:
Cerium (Shamelessly ripped from Hybrid by D1st0rt)

getObjectID

public int getObjectID()
Returns the object id for the lvz object this struct represents.

Returns:
See above.

getXLocation

public int getXLocation()
Returns the position of this lvz object, in pixels. For map objects, the origin is the upper left corner of the map. The origin for screen objects is dependant on the position type used.

Returns:
See above.

getYLocation

public int getYLocation()
Returns the position of this lvz object, in pixels. For map objects, the origin is the upper left corner of the map. The origin for screen objects is dependant on the position type used.

Returns:
See above.

getXLocationType

public byte getXLocationType()
Returns the position type for this lvz object. The value returned by this function should be compared to the constants in the hybrid.core.consts.LVZLocationTypes class to determine the origin to use when positioning the LVZ.

Note: This will always return 0 if this lvz object is not a screen object.

Returns:
See above.

getYLocationType

public byte getYLocationType()
Returns the position type (origin) for this lvz object. The value returned by this function should be compared to the constants in the hybrid.core.consts.LVZLocationTypes class.

Note: This will always return 0 if this lvz object is not a screen object.

Returns:
See above.

getImageID

public byte getImageID()
Returns the image this lvz object is currently using. For the object to be visible, it must use a valid image id, specified in one of the lvz files currently being used in the level.

Returns:
See above.

getLayer

public byte getLayer()
Returns the layer this lvz object will be displayed on. The value returned by this function can be compared to the constants in the hybrid.core.consts.LVZLayers class.

Returns:
See above.

getDisplayTime

public int getDisplayTime()
Returns the amount of time the lvz object will be displayed (in centiseconds) before it will be automatically hidden.

Returns:
See above.

getDisplayMode

public byte getDisplayMode()
Returns the display mode for this lvz object. The value returned by this function should be compared to the constants in the hybrid.core.consts.LVZDisplayModes class.

Returns:
See above.

updateLocation

public LvzObject updateLocation(boolean boolUpdate)
Toggles the 'position' flag. Should be set to true when the specified LVZ objects position should be updated.

Parameters:
boolUpdate - true when the LVZ objects position should be updated, false otherwise.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

This LvzObject structure.

setObjectID

public LvzObject setObjectID(int intObjectID)
Sets the id for the lvz object this structure represents. This does not edit or replacing an existing object id.

Parameters:
intObjectID - The id for the lvz object to edit.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setXLocation

public LvzObject setXLocation(int intLocation)
Sets the distance from this objects origin, in pixels. For map objects, the origin is the upper left corner of the map. For screen objects, the origin is determined by the position type.

Parameters:
intLocation - Distance from the origin, in pixels.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setYLocation

public LvzObject setYLocation(int intLocation)
Sets the distance from this objects origin, in pixels. For map objects, the origin is the upper left corner of the map. For screen objects, the origin is determined by the position type.

Parameters:
intLocation - Distance from the origin, in pixels.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setXLocationType

public LvzObject setXLocationType(byte bType)
Sets the position type for this lvz object.

Note: Location types only apply to screen objects. If this lvz object is a map object, this function will return silently.

Parameters:
bType - The position type to use. Valid position types are defined in the class hybrid.core.consts.LVZLocationTypes.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setYLocationType

public LvzObject setYLocationType(byte bType)
Sets the position type for this lvz object.

Note: Location types only apply to screen objects. If this lvz object is a map object, this function will return silently.

Parameters:
bType - The position type to use. Valid position types are defined in the class hybrid.core.consts.LVZLocationTypes.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setImageID

public LvzObject setImageID(int intImageID)
Sets the image this lvz object should use. The image must be define in one of the level files currently in use in the arena.

Parameters:
intImageID - The new image id for this lvz object.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setLayer

public LvzObject setLayer(byte bLayer)
Sets the layer to display this lvz object on.

Parameters:
bLayer - The layer to display this object on. Valid layer types are defined in the class hybrid.core.consts.LVZLayers.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setDisplayTime

public LvzObject setDisplayTime(int intDisplayTime)
Sets the amount of time to display this lvz object, in centiseconds, before hiding it. This setting is ignored for lvz objcts whos display mode is 'ShowAlways'. For all other modes, setting this value to 0 will display it indefinitely.

Parameters:
intDisplayTime - Amount of time to display this object, in centiseconds.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.

setDisplayMode

public LvzObject setDisplayMode(byte bDisplayMode)
Sets the display mode for this lvz object. The display mode effects when the lvz object will be displayed by the clients.

Parameters:
bDisplayMode - The new display mode for this lvz object. Value display modes are defined in the class hybrid.core.consts.LVZDisplayModes.
Returns:
This LvzObject structure.
